requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

functional_requirements.description: Users can add new tasks to their to-do list.
acceptance_criteria: When a user enters text into the input field and presses 'Enter' or clicks an 'Add' button, the new task appears in the task list.
The input field is cleared after a task is successfully added.

functional_requirements.description: Display all current tasks in a clear, organized list.
acceptance_criteria: All added tasks are displayed in a vertical list.
Each task in the list clearly shows its description.
The list indicates whether a task is complete or pending.

functional_requirements.description: Users can mark a task as completed or reopen it.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a checkbox or a similar control to mark it as complete.
Clicking the control toggles the task's status between 'pending' and 'completed'.
Completed tasks are visually distinct from pending tasks (e.g., strikethrough text, different color).

functional_requirements.description: Users can modify the description of an existing task.
acceptance_criteria: Users can click an 'edit' icon or double-click a task to make its text editable.
After editing, the user can save the changes, and the task list updates immediately.

functional_requirements.description: Users can remove a task from their to-do list.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a 'delete' button or icon.
Clicking the delete button permanently removes the task from the list after a confirmation prompt.

functional_requirements.description: Ensure that tasks persist even after the user closes the application.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks are saved automatically to the browser's LocalStorage.
When the user closes and reopens the browser, their task list is restored to its last state.

functional_requirements.description: Allow users to reorder tasks to reflect their priority.
acceptance_criteria: Users can drag and drop tasks to change their order in the list.
The new order is saved and persists after a page refresh.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must be responsive and work seamlessly on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
metrics: All interactive elements are easily clickable on touchscreens.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should load quickly and provide a smooth user experience.
metrics: Initial page load time under 2 seconds on a standard 3G connection.
UI updates (add, delete, edit) should feel instantaneous (under 100ms).

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must function correctly on the latest versions of major web browsers.
metrics: Full functionality on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
Consistent look and feel across all supported browsers.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be usable by people with disabilities.
metrics: Compliance with WCAG 2.1 Level AA guidelines for color contrast, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support.

risks: Data Loss: Since data is stored in LocalStorage, users will lose all their tasks if they clear their browser cache. This should be communicated to the user.
Scope Creep: The project could grow beyond a simple to-do list, with requests for features like user accounts, cloud sync, and collaboration, which would significantly increase complexity.
Cross-Browser Compatibility: Minor CSS or JavaScript inconsistencies may arise between different browsers, requiring extra testing and conditional code.
assumptions: The initial version will use browser LocalStorage for data persistence, eliminating the need for a backend database and user authentication.
The user interface will be clean and minimalist, focusing on core functionality without complex animations or custom graphics.
Task categorization will be implemented using a simple tagging system rather than a complex hierarchical structure.
The application is intended for personal use, so collaboration and multi-user features are out of scope.

message: Requirements analysis complete. Awaiting human review.
